skill.name: the-archivist
skill.description: This skill should be used when engineering decisions are being made during code implementation. The Archivist enforces decision documentation as a standard practice, ensuring every engineering choice includes rationale and integrates with Architecture Decision Records (ADRs). Use when writing code that involves choosing between alternatives, selecting technologies, designing architectures, or making trade-offs.

skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only markdown templates and guidance for Architecture Decision Records. No executable code, no network access, no file system operations, no external commands. Contains only documentation files.

content.user_title: Record architectural decisions with structured templates
content.value_statement: Engineering teams lose critical context when decisions are undocumented and engineers leave. This skill enforces documentation of architectural choices so the "why" survives beyond any single team member.
actual_capabilities: Generate inline decision comments for code files
Create brief DECISIONS.md entries for module-level choices
Write full Architecture Decision Records for architectural significance
Provide templates for documenting alternatives and trade-offs
Guide decision tier assessment based on scope and reversibility
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Does not integrate with version control systems
Does not enforce documentation through CI/CD pipelines
Does not search existing ADRs automatically

use_cases.title: Document code choices inline
use_cases.description: Add inline comments explaining why specific approaches were chosen over alternatives in code reviews and implementation.

use_cases.title: Record architectural decisions
use_cases.description: Create formal ADRs for technology selections, architecture patterns, and system-wide design choices that affect multiple components.

use_cases.title: Track significant trade-offs
use_cases.description: Maintain a searchable decision log of why the team made specific technical choices and what alternatives were considered.

prompt_templates.title: Quick decision capture
prompt_templates.prompt: Add an inline comment explaining why we use [approach] for [benefit] versus [alternative] because [reason]

prompt_templates.title: Tier 2 decision entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a DECISIONS.md entry with context, decision, rationale, alternatives rejected, and consequences

prompt_templates.title: Full ADR creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete ADR using the MADR template including decision drivers, considered options, chosen option with justification, and consequences

prompt_templates.title: Decision review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code change and identify decisions that need documentation, suggesting appropriate tier and providing draft text

output_examples.input: Why are we using Redis for session storage instead of in-memory sessions?
output: **In the context of** user session management,
**we decided** to use Redis for session storage
**and neglected** in-memory sessions and database sessions,
**to achieve** stateless application servers and sub-millisecond session lookups,
**accepting that** we add operational complexity and a failure dependency.

best_practices: Document decisions before implementing, not after
Always explain why the chosen approach was selected over alternatives
Link code to related ADRs with reference comments
anti_patterns: Using vague justifications like "this is the best approach"
Writing ADRs after the fact to justify decisions already made
Creating ADRs that are never referenced from code

faq.question: Does this skill work with any programming language?
faq.answer: Yes, inline comment templates support all common languages. The decision documentation is language-agnostic.

faq.question: What formats does the skill support for output?
faq.answer: MADR-inspired markdown, inline comments, Y-Statement format, and brief DECISIONS.md entries.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing documentation workflow?
faq.answer: The skill provides templates you can copy. Integration with CI/CD or documentation tools requires separate setup.

faq.question: Is my decision data stored externally?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates text locally. All documentation stays in your repository.

faq.question: How is this different from other documentation skills?
faq.answer: Focuses specifically on decision rationale rather than general documentation. Templates capture why choices were made.

faq.question: Which AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Compatible with any LLM that follows markdown templates.
